reviews.text: Stayed at the Amalia for 2n with wife and 5yr old daughter. Hotel absolutely fine if a bit dated; decor very 1960s-70s, but clean and serviceable. Good value at €85pn. Good views from pool and comfy beds. Recommend
reviews.title: Good value so long as you like 70s kitsch!

reviews.text: You won't regret staying here! We decided to splash out from our usual budget and stay here (but at 95 euros for a triple room booked only a few days in advance I don't think you can complain) and are glad we did. Having spent a very hot day travelling and sightseeing it was great to come here and chill out,have a swim and then a good dinner. Location is great,plenty of parking and while some people may not like the design,we loved it! Our room certainly wasn't out of date and was clean and comfortable with a view out over the garden. We enjoyed the buffet dinner and thought the 15 euro price was very reasonable. Breakfast was included and there were plenty of choices. As previously mentioned it is used for tour groups but we didn't have any problems so don't let it put you off.
reviews.title: Great hotel
Wonderful night in Delphi
reviews.text: We are solo travelers and chose this hotel on our own. We were perfectly satisfied with our stay here. The room was good-sized, clean and comfortable, we had a large terrace with a gorgeous view, and the hotel staff really impressed us - when we overslept and missed breakfast, they made a free breakfast for us to order and served it in our room. The hotel is located just off the main streets, and is quite close to the archaeological site. We were not disturbed by the tour groups - perhaps because we both got in late and slept late?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As others have noticed, the decor is a bit dated - it was built in the 1960s and the hotel certainly reflects the style of that period, but we thought it was pretty cool to stay in a 60s-style hotel. Gives it character!
reviews.title: Amalia Delphi

reviews.text: Finally, I was trying to recall what our TV looked like after reading some of the comments here, but I have absolutely no recollection of it...who goes to Delphi to watch TV?
reviews.title: Very odd and not so good.

reviews.text: Stayed overnight with a bus tour group. Evening meal & breakfast were included in the package and both had a good selection of foods to choose from. Room was very clean & bedding in good condition. Door out to balcony is a little tricky to use but the view is outstanding, except for the seeing the lower level motel roof.
reviews.title: Impressive views

reviews.text: Nice simple pool area with bar service. A good place to relax with a swim ( towels at pool side) and a beer while enjoying the view.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with the best view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was extremely nice and we spent one night at Amlia hotel. Very nice service and the food was excellent and I tried the dinner open buffet and the breakfast as well and both are nice. We were lucky to have the nice view rooms so make sure you ask for it. It worth what we paid for
reviews.title: Impressive hotel but lacks the personal touch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Amalia stands at the top of the hill and first thoughts are it is an impressive hotel. The foyer is large and spacious the reception staff were efficient and welcoming. The seating area by reception is comfortable and very large so it was nice to be able to have a conversation with your own group than being overheard by other groups. The swimming pool is clean and large - a little cold for me but I'm a wimp. Lots of reasonably comfortable loungers some in the sunshine others in shade.
reviews.title: Beautiful views

reviews.text: The grounds are relatively pretty but the views across the mountains is breathtaking.
reviews.title: Fantastic Retreat

reviews.text: The experience has been quite negative. The Hotel has a beautiful view, but everything else was not at a level of 4 stars hotel: room, swimming pool, breakfast. The cleanliness was very poor as the bathroom.
reviews.title: Low price but very low standard for a 4 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights in June and had a very pleasant stay. We booked on the internet and got a very reasonable price including breakfast.
reviews.title: Good base for a visit to Delphi

reviews.text: If you like architecture from the sixties, you will love this hotel. It has been sensitively refurbished and the public spaces are great. There is also free wifi in the public areas.
reviews.title: Our favorite hotel in Greece

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are a good size, with large bathrooms and all have balconies (with a table and chairs) which look down to the gulf and get the afternoon and evening sun. The rooms are reasonably well appointed with fridges and plenty of storage. The one thing I didn't like was that the rooms are carpeted, but they are clean.
reviews.title: Nice pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is plentiful but nothing special. We didn't have dinner at the hotel, preferring to walk into town (10 mins) to a local taverna.
reviews.title: Nice stay!

reviews.text: This Hotel is nicely located above the center of Delphi and has a very strange but nice architecture and interior design.
reviews.title: average

reviews.text: The rooms are spacious and are correct but as many times in Greece, the staff is badly trained, cannot smile and are not motivated. This results in bad service and a lack of hygiene.
reviews.title: Brutalist sanctuary

reviews.text: From the cleanliness around the pool, in the rooms and in the restaurants.
reviews.title: Great Modern Gem. Best place in Delphi.

reviews.text: Just an average Hotel. Not good but not horrible.
reviews.title: Great location with stunning views
good but resembles a prison/ university hostel
reviews.text: As usual the orange juice is undrinkable in a land that produces oranges???
